As a Talent Acquisition Lead, you will manage a team of world class recruiters in their pursuit to grow Spotify at lightning speed. We are looking for a dedicated people leader who can inspire our TA team to achieve, evaluate and measure work, and coach recruiters in their practice.
Location
New York
Job type
Permanent
What you'll do
Support technical recruiters and their relationships with key business partners
Work closely with the TA Manager and HR to align your team’s progress to the overall strategic objectives
Create and implement world-class, global staffing processes and business strategies to achieve an annual hiring plan that emphasizes scale, quality and speed of hires
Nurture relationships with senior members of the business, and communicate progress towards hiring goals
Establish key performance metrics for the TA function, with the goal of creating an outstanding and purpose driven TA organization
Implement and promote Diversity and Inclusion programs in recruitment
Lead and inspire dedicated recruiters to deliver outstanding results while effectively communicating the critical dimensions of the staffing strategy, updating the staffing status and ensuring tight alignment with the business plans
Design and support professional development plans, helping recruiters grow in their competence, and gain new skills
Take on requisitions as needed
Who you are
An experienced people leader, who thrives on mentoring and encouraging your team to success
Extensive experience as an in-house talent team leader, or at a recruitment / exec search firm
Demonstrated success in building out, leading, and developing teams of high-performing individuals
Experience working for a global company, preferably supporting hiring leaders at/in satellite offices (outside of the global headquarters.)
Demonstrable track record of developing recruiting professionals at all levels and in diverse business units
Strong analytical skills and ability to work with metrics, numbers and trends
Adept at influencing through strong relationships, expertise and data
Ability to partner with a sophisticated set of stakeholders
Comfortable rolling up your sleeves to get things done in tandem with participating in deeply complex strategy discussions
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships; an ability to identify and galvanize a complex web of relationships and dependencies to holistically solve problems and seize opportunities.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location and is within working hours.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration and ask that all be located in that time zone.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.

Overview:

This manager will have a direct impact on improving individual and organizational performance by creating innovative and engaging learning & development programs, offerings and tools that develop leadership and managerial competencies for all retail and non-retail employees. This position is responsible for the management, alignment, marketing, design, measurement strategy, development, and execution of appropriate behavioral-based programs and offerings regarding leadership and manager development to ensure adoption and usability. This is to be accomplished with an agile mindset and through consultation practices with stakeholders throughout the business to gain an understanding of business issues and goals.
As a member of the broader Global Talent Center of Excellence function, this individual will have opportunities to influence and contribute to other key enterprise initiatives.

The Role: Data Associate, LCD

The Location: Charlottesville, VA or Eastern United States

The Team: Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD) has more than three dozen journalists and analysts providing news and research on the leveraged finance markets to 80,000 plus subscribers worldwide. We are a leading information provider whose success hinges upon producing a premier data and research product.

The data content team is responsible for maintaining LCD’s databases, ensuring that not only is information entered in a timely fashion, but also with the utmost attention to accuracy and quality. Our team currently resides in NY, London and Charlottesville.

The Impact : As an analyst, you will handle all aspects of data management, including the secondary market data behind LCD's loan indexes, the primary market data behind LCD’s market technicals and investor market data (BDCs, CLOs, etc.). Management of this data is a cornerstone to LCD’s unique content and maintaining our position in market.

What’s in it for you:
Develop your analytical skills and research abilities

Explore a highly-rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards

Learn from industry-leading analysts and experts

Responsibilities :
Provide support to the analytical team by building & updating leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles in LCD’s proprietary database based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market.

Bring together information from market sources such as SEC filings, Ratings Direct, CapitalIQ, and update LCD’s related databases and analysis.

Develop an understanding LCD’s production processes for its research reports and analysis.

Support senior analysts and other group members for varied data collection processes and analysis.

Build your knowledge of the basics of the leveraged finance markets including loans and high yield bonds. This includes the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation.

What We’re Looking For:Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors’ degree in finance or accounting, or equivalent experience

Strong attention to detail, particularly with regards to the ability to accurately handle data.

Ability to be an independent self-starter in a fast-paced environment.

Intellectual curiosity and dedication to learn about financial markets.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Access is a plus.

Preferred Qualifications:
Internship experience in finance, accounting, or related field

Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $46,200 USD to $129,200 USD. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location and experience.

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive bonus.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

S&P Global Corporate
At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include S&P Global Ratings, S&P Global Market Intelligence, S&P Dow Jones Indices and S&P Global Platts. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com

Description & Requirements
Position Summary
As an Associate, Paid Social you will assist in the day-to-day stewarding of both account and media activity on assigned campaigns for our top clients, and help take social media planning to the next level. This entry-level opportunity will kick-start your career in media and provide a platform to partner with the world’s leading consumer brands
Key Responsibilities
Work closely with Account/Media team on the development, implementation and optimization of campaigns to successfully execute the defined strategy and achieve business results
Serve as resource in terms of gathering and distributing research around the industry or our clients
Develop a strong working relationship with the media sales community, specifically our partners, to become the point person for day to day needs and account maintenance for all active campaigns
Investigate new sites/media vehicles relevant to clients’ media campaigns
Work with sales reps to develop new tactics (placements, creative units) to improve performance of clients’ advertising
Use research tools to develop profile of target audiences with view into their social/online behaviors, media consumption, etc.
Ensure agreed upon pacing and delivery of campaigns, prompt delivery of reports to clients and accurate/useful performance reports
Become proficient with 3rd party ad-serving, tracking & analytic systems to be able to accurately input media plan details and launch campaigns
Maintain detailed files of all pertinent records (latest media plans, performance reports, etc.) relevant to clients’ business with Society
Reconcile all campaigns to ensure that client receives all planned media and is invoiced/credited properly
Desired Skills & Experience
0-2-year experience in advertising or interactive digital media
Demonstrated enthusiasm for interactive media / marketing with strong working knowledge of the Internet – and an active user / participant in social media a plus.
Proactive ability to multi-task, strong written and oral communication skills, excellent organizational aptitude, attention to detail, and accuracy when working with numbers
Strong desire to learn and build knowledge of: social media, native advertising, marketing principles, marketing platforms (e.g., Facebook and Twitter Advertising), interactive media, and direct response strategies and tactics

As the global performance marketing agency of IPG Mediabrands, we are obsessed with Customer Flow, the continuous movement of customers along the path to purchase. Company Description
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description
The Opportunity
Are you passionate about supporting the creation of a high-performance growth culture? Are you motivated by a diverse and inclusive environment that unleashes the potential in everyone, everywhere? Are you someone that has experience in large globally minded teams but runs at a fast paced startup mentality? Come join the Global Talent Management team as we help write a new story for Visa and reimagine the world of work. As Visa works to create a future where everyone can thrive, the Global Talent Management team is working to create talent and culture practices that enable all employees, everywhere to thrive.
The Talent Management Associate will serve as the support to key initiatives and programs that drive individual success and Visa’s impact in the world. In this role your mission will be to ensure the consistently high delivery of the operations and execution of programs and projects across the Talent Management offering.
What you’ll be responsible for…
You’ll own the way in which Talent Management reports its progress and impact to both the business and the People Team; in partnership with the Analytics team you’ll establish the sound reporting dashboards and mechanisms, maintaining our talent data, and crafting the appropriate narrative to story-tell the facts.
You’ll intuitively be able to identify opportunities to streamline, automate and improve our processes to strengthen the foundations for long term success.
You’ll eagerly provide creative support to your Talent Management colleagues by producing the PowerPoint decks that support strategic decision making; the presentations will deliver a powerful message, with seamless flow and crisp impact through the narrative and use of data.
You’ll also own the intranet pages where Talent projects its messages, maintaining the content and initiating updates to ensure colleagues across Visa have the most updated information at their fingertips.
You’ll quickly become the program owner for some of the more established or ‘new to launch’ programs which drive the engagement, growth and inclusion of our employees and leaders across Visa’s global workforce.

Qualifications
Locations: New York or Foster City, CA
Basic Qualifications:

2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications:

A minimum of 2 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree.You’ll personally thrive in a fast-paced environment where juggling priorities is your norm but have an eye for detail which keeps your delivery accurate.You’ll be a guru of PowerPoint, Excel and have knowledge of data modelling techniques plus enjoy navigating HR systems. Prior experience of WorkDay would be a benefit but is not a prerequisite.You’ll be emotionally intelligent, with a customer first mindset and able to think in the shoes of others.Finally you’re so team oriented that you instinctively collaborate, foster relationships and actively listen which enables you to solve problems quickly and efficiently.
Additional Information
Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law

Met Council’s ten different departments are staffed by experts who helped over 305,000 clients in 2020 and continuously advocate on behalf of all needy New Yorkers. Our holistic programs range from 100% affordable housing at 20 locations to our award-winning family violence program to comprehensive Holocaust survivor assistance to senior programming to crisis intervention to the largest free kosher food distribution program in the world. Our network of 101 food pantries, 20 affordable housing sites, and 15 JCCs provide services directly in neighborhoods across New York.

NYU Langone Health is a world-class, patient-centered, integrated academic medical center, known for its excellence in clinical care, research, and education. It comprises more than 200 locations throughout the New York area, including five inpatient locations, a children's hospital, three emergency rooms and a level 1 trauma center. Also part of NYU Langone Health is the Laura and Isaac Perlmutter Cancer Center, a National Cancer Institute designated comprehensive cancer center, and NYU Grossman School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. For more information, go to nyulangone.org, and interact with us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Indeed, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Instagram.

Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Refrigeration Helper.


In this role, the successful candidate Responsible for performing the duties peculiar to, and normally required in, the trade of refrigeration, following accepted procedures and techniques of the refrigeration trade.


Job Responsibilities:

Schedules work assignments of engineering shop members and maintain records of work time and other documentation as may be required and monitors their work. Schedules and monitors daily work for staff on all shifts. Reassigns staff as necessary. Reviews personal days and vacation schedules to avoid overlay or negative impact on the shop and operation. Reviews engineers daily documentation (e.g., chiller and shift log), incident reports and follow up with appropriate action. Takes appropriate action to solve problems and notify management with regards to daily operation.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Provides guidance and directions regarding trade techniques when working with an assigned helper. Has a good knowledge on NYUs Medical Centers emergency procedure coordinates information with other shops, clients, and management during emergencies such as floods, fire alarms. This includes interaction with outside municipal agencies (i.e. Fire Department, etc.) as necessary. Interacts with peers, management, and clients, outside personnel is performed in an interpersonally smooth and courteous manner.
Work Activities - Participates on inspecting work sites to determine procedure, material and equipment needed to complete work assignment as professionally and quickly as possible. Transports materials, tools, and equipment to the work site as needed. Requests material, tools, and equipment as needed from foreman and stockroom. Protects public in working areas from bodily harm at all times. Protects equipment and tools from damage. Reports competition of assignments of task to the foreman. Keeps the work area neat at all times. Follows safety procedures and requirements as requested by the Department and Institution. Sanitizes ice machines and cleans water filters as needed. Responsible for cleaning A/C units, change filters, condensers as requested.
Orders supplies and equipment through manger, to maintain adequate stock for daily operation and planned activities. Reviews scheduled daily long term work to ensure that adequate materials are on hand or order them if necessary through manager. Checks readiness of equipment for specialized work. Monitors and maintains inventory of disposals used on chillers, such as oil, oil filters, solution filters.
Communicates the objective of assignments to members of shop and solicits feedback to ensure assignment is understood. Assigns work in order to accomplish goals in a timely and professional fashion and make allowances for individual initiative. Communicates the need for new policies and procedures to supervisor in a timely fashion helps management develop and implement them. Communicates the reason for delay in accomplishing work to supervisor in a reasonable time.

Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a Five years experience. Trade or vocational school graduation shall reduce the above requirement to four years.

Preferred Qualifications:
Possesses a N.Y. C. FIRE DEPARTMENT unlimited refrigeration permits. Demonstrates leadership and interpersonal skills. Previous foreman or supervisory experience is required.

Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

The Bureau of Sexually Transmitted Infections (BSTI) has the mission of improving the sexual heath of all New Yorkers. To achieve this the Bureau provides direct clinic services to people seeking sexual health care, and services to sex partners; monitors disease trends; provides education and training to providers and community groups, conducts research and develop policies to improve sexual health and wellness. The Bureau of Sexually Transmitted Infections (BSTI) operates 8 STI clinics throughout New York City (NYC). The Bureau of Sexually Transmitted Infections (BSTI) is requesting to hire a Public Health Assistant to work in the Sexual Health Clinics.


DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:


Setting up physician examination rooms and ensuring that the appropriate instruments are available. Assisting physician in the examination of patients.

Documenting forms, preparing slides, positioning patients and completing documentation for culture plates.

Performing clerical functions, such as registration.

Posting laboratory results.

Assisting with maintenance of inventory supplies and pharmaceuticals and when necessary preparing order forms for supplies.

Preparing patient for Long Acting Reversible Contraception (LARC) examination and insertions by ensuring that patient is properly positioned and provides assistance to and comforts patients in a manner which facilitates the clinical examination and LARC service.
Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State’s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization; or


2. Completion of eleventh grade of high school, and one year of full-time satisfactory experience performing health-related or clerical duties.


3. Education and/or experience that is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have completed the eleventh grade of high school.
Preferred Skills

Bilingual: English/Spanish
Additional Information

**IMPORTANT NOTES TO ALL CANDIDATES:

Please note: If you are called for an interview you will be required to bring to your interview copies of original documentation, such as:
A document that establishes identity for employment eligibility, such as: A Valid U.S. Passport, Permanent Resident Card/Green Card, or Driver’s license.

Proof of Education according to the education requirements of the civil service title.

Current Resume

Proof of Address/NYC Residency dated within the last 60 days, such as: Recent Utility Bill (i.e. Telephone, Cable, Mobile Phone)

Additional documentation may be required to evaluate your qualification as outlined in this posting’s “Minimum Qualification Requirements” section. Examples of additional documentation may be, but not limited to: college transcript, experience verification or professional trade licenses.

If after your interview you are the selected candidate you will be contacted to schedule an on-boarding appointment. By the time of this appointment you will be asked to produce the originals of the above documents along with your original Social Security card.

Job Description:
Business Overview
Our Global Corporate & Investment Banking business focuses on building long-term relationships with more than 3,000 large U.S. and multinational corporations, financial institutions and financial sponsors. We provide strong advisory expertise, capitalizing on powerful mergers and acquisitions, corporate banking, treasury, debt and equity product expertise to deliver integrated financial solutions.
The Roadshow Coordinator organizes logistics and prepares schedules for corporate management teams to meet with prospective and/or existing investors in connection with an equity or debt capital raise. As such, the position entails heavy client interaction, primarily with corporate management teams, as well as, Equity /(remove) Debt Capital Markets and the institutional salesforce.
Job Description
Key tasks and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
Heavy logistics coordination including, but not limited to, hotels, ground transportation, private air, commercial air and conferences / private investor events
Meeting coordination - Work in conjunction with Sales and Capital Markets to arrange a daily marketing schedule for equity and debt clients. Coordinate meeting times and feasibility based upon travel, investor demand and client availability.
Client Services - Heavy contact with corporate management teams; must be able to balance a client’s demands against the greater good; must be professional, responsive and polite in extremely difficult circumstances.
Research and select venues, menu and make arrangements for conference calls, Netroadshow remove and add roadshow and audio-visual for Management Presentations / Roadshow Kickoffs remove and add roadshows and Investor functions.
Perform duties of on-site staff person to oversee and coordinate all aspects of special events, especially investor presentations, for groups of 20 to 200 attendees.
Reconciliation of all roadshow-related expenses.
Key Skills for this role are:
Ability to effectively and extensively interact with all levels of Capital Markets professionals, from Analysts to Managing Directors within the corporation; as well as, senior ranking officers from Corporate Issuers (i.e. CEO, COO, CFO, etc.)
Effective multi-tasking skills – Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Stress Management – Ability to maintain composure during stressful situations.
Team-oriented – Ability to partner with local, regional and global counterparts on a daily basis.
Time Management – Must work efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced environment; • Must be flexible with working hours – Willingness and ability to work extended hours when necessary.
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree and/or 2-3 years of roadshow coordination experience
Computer skills a must
Organized, detail-oriented and ability to multi-task
Personable and professional - people-oriented and decision-maker
Accessible and responsive at all times, including off-peak hours

1st shift (United States of America)

Responsibilities:

Delivering the JPMorgan Chase event standards at every level.
Ability to plan events that can range from 10 to 500 people, with various degrees of complexity.
Monitor/manage the project including; creation of project plans and budgets (prepare, manage & reconcile).
Adhere to departmental procedures and processes.
Mitigating risk and compliance aspects for each meeting or event.
Ability to lead both internal and external event teams and direct many facets at one time.
Collaborate and interact effectively with Firm's senior management, middle management and customers.
Provide strategic input and recommendations to business group on event development.
Maintain partnering relationships with internal business partners such as Food Services, Conference -Services, Global Technology team, Security and Facilities.
Manage all aspects of events including but not limited to: internal consulting, concept proposal development, site selection via RFP process, vendor negotiation, contract administration (including controlling risks associated with attrition and cancellation), hotel management, air/ground travel, total logistics coordination (menus, setup, decor, audio visual), creative writing for invitation, input on website development, printing, registration management, coordination of speakers, giveaways, entertainment, activities, and travel staff.
Ability to manage a virtual and hybrid meeting.

Qualifications:

A minimum 3-5 years experience in a full-time position as a professional meeting planner or closely related position such as Hotel Conference Services Manager, Special Events Planner or Catering Manager.
Project management, time management, multi-tasking, ability to set priorities and communication skills a necessity.
Demonstrate high level of judgment and ability to respond quickly and diplomatically to stressful, difficult and changing situations.
Must also be detailed-oriented, show initiative and work effectively as both a team member and independently.
Strong verbal and written communications skills, interpersonal and customer service skills.
Self-motivated, self-starting, team driven, and a creative thinker.
Knowledge of business processes and procedures.
Ability to work extended hours which may include evening and/or weekend event support.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Experience managing meetings using a Registration Management System
Virtual and hybrid meeting experience beneficial

Travel to off-site locations - up to 50% - 70% travel
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. These requirements may include sharing information in the firm's vaccine record tool, vaccination or regular testing, mask wearing, social distancing and daily health checks. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests.

Company Description
Sia Partners is a next-generation consulting firm focused on delivering superior value and tangible results to its clients as they navigate the digital revolution. Our global footprint and expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allow us to enhance our clients’ businesses worldwide. We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT & digital strategy, and Data Science.
Why join the Sia Village?
Excellence | Entrepreneurship | Innovation | Teamwork | Care & Support | Employee Wellbeing
These are the six core values that guide all our actions. As an expression of our values, our Sia Village concept describes our commitment to fostering a sense of community within and among our offices. We believe that knowledge sharing is the key, not only to innovation, but to the growth and development of our people.
What You'll Do
Our US Cybersecurity team is an integral part of our Global Store Front, providing support to our clients on a wide array of topics, including but not limited to:
Strategy
Compliance
Risk
Resilience
Training & Knowledge Management

Job Description

Project manage and/or support on a range of client delivery, as part of an on-site or remote project team
Conduct effective meetings
Execute on assessments such as NIST, ISO 2700x, RCSA, etc.
Collaborate with internal and client project team members, and contribute to internal communications and readiness activity within the program team and with client groups
Provide status reporting of progress using the RAID method – Risks, Assumptions, Issues, Dependencies
Maintain program sites as a repository for all project information
Contribute to the development of high-quality and timely deliverables
Perform subject matter research and business analysis
Assist in the coordination and development of client proposals
Support practice, thought leadership, and people development

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required in either: Business/Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Mathematics, etc.
2 or more years of recent client-facing management consulting experience with an emphasis on cyber related projects, ideally covering one or more of the following topics:
Cybersecurity requirements, metrics, reporting procedures and control frameworks (NIST, ISO, CMMC, SANS, RCSA, etc.)
Cyber, IT, BCP/DR policies and procedures
Third party risk management (TPRM) / vendor risk
Red / Purple teaming
Penetration testing, vulnerability scans
Cloud security and/or network expertise (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Data mapping and lineage
Incident response and crisis management
Tabletop exercises
Knowledge of cryptography and/or blockchain a plus
Holds or is willing to obtain within the first year of joining one of the following certifications: CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC, CEH, etc.
Ability to demonstrate and apply knowledge of data protection regulation and laws to consulting projects, such as the EU-GDPR, CCPA/CPRA, HIPAA, GLBA, and CDPA
Strong working knowledge and application of cybersecurity frameworks and standards such as NIST, ISO, etc.
Based near one of our U.S. operating offices and eligibility to work within the United States
Additional Information
Please be aware that Sia Partners requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. “Fully vaccinated” means that the individual can provide acceptable proof that the individual has received, at least fourteen (14) days prior to the individual’s start date, either the second dose of a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine, or one dose of a single-dose COVID-19 vaccine. Vaccines must be authorized and/or approved by the FDA. Individuals needing an exemption to this requirement due to medical, disability-related, or religious reasons may request an exemption during the recruiting process. The Company will engage in an interactive process to determine if an exemption to this requirement as a reasonable accommodation is appropriate.
Benefits:
Entrepreneurial journey
Career advocacy program that supports achieving professional development goals through guidance, and real-time feedback
Continuous learning & development opportunities
Diversity, equity, and inclusion programs with an ever-growing list of global affinity initiatives
Healthcare coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance policies
College save-up plan & college loan repayment plan
Generous vacation, sick, floating, and holidays, including parental leave
401(k) matching
Annual seminar, an in-person value-add experience that allows you to network with colleagues throughout North and South America (during non-COVID times)
Our Commitment to Diversity
Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) are part of Sia Partners’ DNA. Thanks to our expertise in several sectors and our international growth, our teams include a variety of experiences and cultures. Overview:
BROOKLYN, NY- WFH executives looking for a FULL TIME LIVE OUT NANNY M-F 8AM-4PM for their happy 5-month-old boy! Pay is open, $20-30/hr gross via payroll + PTO + metro card. They are looking for someone who is adaptable and flexible; someone who they will get along with and can be an extension of them as parents! Must be a great communicator and must have an overall pleasant disposition and positive demeanor. They are new parents who love spending time with their son, but they both have careers that are important to them, too. Their schedules shift sometimes throughout the work day. An example: meetings get cancelled or mom is able to decline a meeting to spend time with her son, nanny was playing with him and will be flexible and hand baby to mom and help with baby's laundry or washing bottles in the meantime, or organizing toys, cleaning up etc. If a meeting/call comes up unexpectedly and parent needs to get back to work nanny would be able to takeover for parent with baby related activity whether that be feeding a bottle or putting baby down for a nap etc. Taking baby to the park or for a walk, reading books and being creative in ways to approach playtime with a Montessori style are strongly desired. A nanny who is comfortable with dogs is critical as they have a very snuggly and large dog. It would be great if nanny was able to help occasionally feed dog or take him out to use the bathroom since they don't have a yard. They do not expect this to be a frequent ask, but maybe if they are caught up in meetings and baby is sleeping. They are on the third floor of their building, so you must be physically capable of climbing them up and down daily. Someone who is enthusiastic about children, is willing to get down and play with baby in creative ways is preferred! Company Description
The Mill is a global creative partner for agencies, production companies and brands, working across all media channels and platforms.
We are trusted specialists in visual effects, creative technologies and content production. Our projects include the creation of digital products and virtual experiences, as well as world class visual effects and video production.
We are a vibrant network of talented artists, producers, directors and creative technologists from multinational backgrounds. We nurture innovation, flexibility and diverse ideas across our studios in London, New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Berlin and Bangalore. We are all united by one single ambition: To create extraordinary and memorable work that captivates and excites audiences.
We are The Mill. We create the extraordinary.

Job Description
Description of Role
The Mill has been creating world-class visual effects built on creative excellence and cutting-edge technologies for over twenty-seven years. We believe in creating work that touches people emotionally, that becomes popular culture and that people love, talk about, and want to share. We believe in great ideas beautifully told. The Mill is looking for a Previs Artist to join their team in New York.
Responsibilities
Pre-visualizing complex VFX and CG Animation advertising projects in Maya
Working collaboratively with Directors, VFX Supervisors and other VFX Artists
Come up with visual solutions to best communicate the client and director's vision
Create sequences of shots from storyboards and scripts
Provide technical documentation and data for shots that will be filmed on set

Qualifications
Previous experience with Previs and strong interest in storytelling
Knowledge of cinematic language and fundamentals of staging, lensing and composition
Familiarity with pipeline issues and a typical post production environment
Strong working knowledge of Maya, with adequate knowledge of Rigging
Experience with Nuke, Premiere, After Effects is a plus

Job summary
Amazon’s Web Services retail businesses are seeking talented attorneys for Associate Corporate Counsel positions across our various teams. These attorneys will partner with the legal team and their business operations clients to achieve operational excellence, ensure compliance with state and federal regulators, consider legal issues of first impression and move strategic deals through to completion.

Amazon is a leader in global e-commerce. Our innovative technologies change the way people find, discover and buy products and services. Lawyers at Amazon are trusted members of the business. Our work is intellectually challenging and exciting. Developing innovative solutions to novel legal questions is part of our daily business.

Some travel, domestic and international, may be required.

Structuring, drafting and negotiating complex commercial agreements, including technology, distribution, licensing and marketing contracts

Serving as lead counsel and directly advising business clients on strategic deals
Resolving issues that arise in existing commercial relationships and handling pre-litigation legal disputes and inquiries

Company Description
The Mill is a global creative partner for agencies, production companies and brands, working across all media channels and platforms.
We are trusted specialists in visual effects, creative technologies and content production Our projects include the creation of digital products and virtual experiences, as well as world class visual effects and video production.
We are a vibrant network of talented artists, producers, directors and creative technologists from multinational backgrounds. We nurture innovation, flexibility and diverse ideas across our studios in London, New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Berlin and Bangalore. We are all united by one single ambition: To create extraordinary and memorable work that captivates and excites audiences.
We are The Mill. We create the extraordinary.

Job Description
The Mill Production Supervisor is a senior production position, and a mentoring role within the production department; it is primarily an internal-facing role. This position requires a high level of numeracy, excellent interpersonal skills, and an in-depth understanding of the broader industry and key business drivers. In order to deliver the standard of work The Mill has become renowned for, a Production Supervisor must have a combination of an excellent knowledge of current technology and techniques, a creative eye, high organizational skills, ability to work within and manage a team and an innate understanding of our clients’ requirements.
The role requires the skills and experience to manage the operation, culture and efficiency of the production department alongside the HOP. The Production Supervisor must have a close working relationship with the Producers, HOP, Director of Production, and EPs at the Mill. This position requires an in-depth understanding of The Mill‘s production pipeline in order to maximize resources, manage and execute projects on time and within budget, and ensure that the Mill capitalizes on all client opportunities.
The PS will manage communication and project workflow with our Producers, EPs, and Operations, ensuring effective planning and coordination in the bidding and execution of projects.
The PS will work alongside the Head of Production to foster a collaborative working environment within the Production team. In this position, the PS will provide leadership and mentorship that promotes the company culture. The PS must have an excellent understanding of The Mill's strategic & internal goals and will help communicate these to the wider production team.
Production Team Management (25%)
Oversee team workload, assist with job assignments, bidding and project vetting.
Monitor individual performance and conduct appraisals for team members.
Provide production teams with training and experience to encourage progression and growth to ensure the “future proofing” of the Production department.
Ensure internal goals & key information is filtered appropriately to the production teams.
As the leader of the production team, the Production Supervisor acts in an advisory role to the more junior members of the team.
Project Management / Delivery (50%)
Ensure the most effective use of the company’s technical, creative and personnel resources to deliver a successful and profitable outcome on all projects.
Ensure that high quality standards and good working practices are met on all projects.
Alongside the HOP, continually monitor projects tracking and ensure they are within budget and resource.
Work to help deliver the correct discount levels and deliver all projects on track financially.
Oversee client bidding and creative pitches where necessary with the more junior members of the production team.
Plan and set ballparks, manage negotiations and quotations with key clients.
There will be an expectation that the PS will produce a number of key, high-profile projects over the year.
There may be a need to attend shoots to further advise on shooting techniques to achieve required FX.
Help maintain & broaden existing relationships.
Encourage producers to understand the importance of director, agency and brand relationships.
Identify and actively foster Mill creative talent and production teams by pairing the correct talent with creative work.
Help to research and source new & up and coming directing/creative talent, that we would like to form relationships with at The Mill.
Monitor the satisfaction of existing clients and ensure that they continue to use The Mill.
Develop and maintain an 'ear' to the market and disseminate relevant information to the production team and key staff at The Mill.
Promote the advancement of new Mill offerings both internally and externally (Mill+, Creative technology, Beam, cross-platform content, volume/relationship driven workflow, etc.)
Must keep abreast of new technology, their application and integration into the working pipeline at The Mill. Must also have a good understanding of new trends and developments in the wider field.
Production Best Practice (25%)
Maintain weekly and monthly oversight of revenue/freelance/workshare/outsourcing targets.
Ensure that weekly WIP meetings take place to track the progress of projects vs. Bid / Budget.
Meet with heads of other Mill departments on a regular basis to share and promote progressive production practices.
Advise the HOP if specific training initiatives are needed and help structure training plans.
Manage communication with the HOP & Director of Production regarding goals/ targets of the company to the production staff.
Ensure that best production practices are being used by team and updated when necessary.

Additional Information

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to recruitment@themill.com and we'll be happy to assist.
At The Mill, we want to work with the best people and we want them to have a great career with us. We will make reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process and beyond to help people shine and enable them to show us their skills and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that reflects the needs of a diverse workforce. We will offer flexible working practices and make relevant workplace adjustments for employees who need them to be at their best.

About the Institution
For more than 100 years, Pace University has been preparing students to become leaders in their fields by providing an education that combines exceptional academics with professional experience and the New York advantage. Pace has campuses in New York City and Westchester County. A private metropolitan university, Pace enrolls nearly 13,000 students in bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral programs in the College of Health Professions, Dyson College of Arts and Sciences, Lubin School of Business, School of Education, Elisabeth Haub School of Law, and Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems.

AA/EEO Statement
Pace University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.
 Minorities, women, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and people of all gender identities are encouraged to apply.

Annual Security Report Notice

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in program management and leading projects.
Experience managing projects and communicating across teams and levels.
Experience with cloud technologies and/or devices.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience with Chrome browser, Chrome OS, Google Workspace and/or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience managing sales programs for enterprise sales teams.
Sales experience in a sales/quota carrying role.
Experience with VDI, web browsers, operating systems, and desktop hardware.
About the job

As a part of the Chrome Enterprise customer organization, you will be part of the team leading our global efforts in driving Chrome and ChromeOS adoption in the enterprise. This will span enterprise adoption of Chrome browser, Chrome OS and Chrome OS management as part of a secure, easy to manage and cost effective endpoint computing platform for our customers. Your experience in integrating strategy, planning and execution across all Go-to-Market functions and co-ordinating with cross-functional stakeholders will be key in accomplishing our goals.

In this role, you will be a key business stakeholder tasked with identifying, planning and executing sales programs to enhance our Go-to-Market efforts. Partnering with various cross-functional team members spanning Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations, Business Development and Product will be a key aspect of this role. You will be responsible for aligning all key program stakeholders, making sure that all necessary tasks are completed and delivering a program that drives value for the sales organization. You will be a subject matter expert during program execution and tracking and communicating program results.
Working with other business units such as Google Cloud, Workspace, Android, etc. will also be a key function of this role. Designing and implementing programs where our go-to-market strategy aligns with these additional business units will be a key success driver in this role.
Responsibilities
Work with a cross-functional team to develop Chrome Enterprise sales programs that drive customer adoption of our Chrome Browser and Chrome OS solutions, while building long-term relationships across the business.
Propose solutions and deliver recommendations on potential sales programs to drive enterprise Chrome adoption.
Develop project schedules, identify stakeholder dependencies and manage risk in delivering sales programs within discussed timelines.
Work closely with other teams such as Google Cloud Platform and Workspace to develop and execute joint sales plays across business units.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Overview
Creating a better way to live is the purpose that binds AvalonBay associates. At AvalonBay, every day is an opportunity to make a difference in someone's life. Whether it’s helping someone choose one of our communities as their home, providing great service to our residents, or supporting our fellow associates, we are committed to creating an unforgettable experience as a great place to live - and work.
The Role
As a Leasing Consultant you will be the driving force in helping residents find the best place to call home. Your creative and thoughtful tours will be customized to individual tastes, from recommending the perfect floorplan to outlining the best new neighborhood restaurants. You know what makes people tick, and follow through on every lead to ensure that our prospective residents know you care.
You Have...
incredible customer service skills. You have a knack for creating a sense of community and the drive to go the extra mile to create a spectacular experience for new residents. Your success and purpose are driven by the relationships that you build.
sales and marketing chops. Your personalized connections and recommendations drive our leasing performance, and your ability to create excitement through creative campaigns, continuous outreach, and social media fuel community enthusiasm for AvalonBay.
follow-through. By understanding what’s important to our prospective residents, you continuously reach out with tailored updates - from the ideal floorplan they’ve been eyeing, to the newest hot-spot openings, to the best food truck in the neighborhood – you help to paint a picture of what it’s like to call your community home.
a genuine desire to help both residents and colleagues in Creating a Better Way to Live.
How AvalonBay Supports You
We know that our teams are the beating heart of our success and we’re committed to showing our appreciation. We offer:
comprehensive benefits – health, dental & vision, 401(k) with company match, paid vacation and holidays, tuition reimbursement, an employee stock purchase plan and more!
growth based on achievement and promotion from within.
associate recognition (like our Live2Lease program, which rewards our star leasing consultants with awards of up to $1,000).
a 20% discount on our incredible apartment homes.
a culture built on purpose and our core values - A Commitment to Integrity, A Spirit of Caring, and A Focus on Continuous Improvement.
Additional Info
AvalonBay is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We believe that in order to achieve our purpose of creating a better way to live, we must recruit, develop and retain associates with a wide range of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives and create an environment that encourages all voices to be heard, understood and appreciated. With this we know we can do great things.

The Quality Assurance team is responsible for validating all work before it goes to production, this includes software: web, mobile, connected device applications, media, non-consumer facing products and more. Additionally, the Quality Assurance teams creates and maintains the framework used for automation testing at DSS and performs all performance testing.

The QA Analyst will be responsible for analyzing requirements, user stories, and design documentation to ensure that they are clearly defined, complete, and testable. The QA Analyst will be responsible for the creation and execution of test plans, test cases, and test scripts to verify new and existing (regression) software functionality. The QA Analyst will test the applications via Black Box, Regression, Release, Stress, and Negative testing methods. The ideal candidate will contribute both to the definition and the enforcement of quality assurance processes and procedures based on best practice methodology.

Responsibilities :

Focus on major areas of work, typically 20% or more of role
Accountability for participating in test activities, creating detailed test plans and writing test cases
Provide status updates for all QA/TPM/Dev resources during the testing cycle
Proactively learn the backend infrastructure, new testing and technology trends, upcoming releases

Required Education :

BS or BA degree preferred or equivalent work experience.

Description:

ABOUT US
Sanctuary for Families is New York’s leading service provider and advocate for survivors of domestic violence, sex trafficking, and related forms of gender violence. Every year, Sanctuary empowers thousands of adults and children to move from fear and abuse to safety and stability, transforming lives through a comprehensive range of services. We provide a range of wrap-around services to help survivors rebuild their lives in the aftermath of abuse, and work to end gender violence through three key strategies: direct services, outreach and training, and systems-change advocacy. Our services are available in 11 locations throughout New York City.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The HR Generalist will be responsible for performing HR-related duties and support staff across the agency. The HR Generalist will carry out responsibilities in recruitment and on-boarding, Kokomo training, communication, and policy implementation. The HR Generalist will partner with the Director and Deputy Director in creating a department culture that promotes trust, transparency and collaboration among all members of staff.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Recruiting
Oversees the recruitment process, makes recommendations for improvements to hiring managers as needed.
Performs full-cycle recruiting as needed for hard-to-fill positions.
Utilize various resources (Indeed, Zip Recruiter, etc.) to post, search, and screen for new candidates / create a pipeline of qualified candidates.
 Develop innovative strategies to reach candidates.
 Ability to track, analyze, and update recruitment metrics via Excel and/or HRM software.
 Support other HR functions and administration of procedures and administration, as needed.
 Maintain the Applicant Tracking System, ensuring data is entered properly.
 Make job offers to all final candidates.
On-boarding
Conduct orientation and onboarding for all new hires.
Initiate applicable background checks.
Work with hiring managers to ensure they receive any support needed for their new hires.
Welcome new employees with the onboarding kit.
Collect paperwork and other related documents from the new hire.
Stay up to date with innovative and creative ways of onboarding new employees.
Tracking Tool
Use COVID-19 tracking tool to administer daily screening survey, and confirm weekly negative PCR testing results.
Collect and record relevant information into the database system with accuracy.
Communicate with staff in a professional and empathetic manner maintaining emotional and cultural awareness.
Manage positive COVID-19 cases and contact staff with CDC guidelines.
Provide staff with approved (CDC Guidelines) information about isolation and quarantine procedures.
Provide weekly reports to Director and Deputy of cases across the Agency.
Training/Communication
Provide trainings on HR systems (Applicant Tracking System).
Edit job descriptions and draft personnel announcements.
Miscellaneous
Maintains compliance with federal and state regulations concerning employment.
Stays up to date with new federal and state regulations.
Assist with HR-related agency-wide staff events such as the Holiday Party, annual staff recognition ceremony, annual staff picnic, etc.
Answers day-to-day employee inquires in areas such as paid time off, payroll, compensation, recruiting.
Ensures employee compliance with all policies and procedures.
Performs other department or agency-related duties and special projects as requested by supervisor.
. Requirements:
Bachelors’ Degree required.
Minimum of five years in the same or similar position.
Must have extensive knowledge of human resources functions including but not limited to recruitment and retention, employee benefits and employee relations.
Exceptional oral and written communications skills.
Demonstrated ability to maintain effective relationships with employees throughout the organization.
Must be collaborative, passionate, and creative and support diversity and inclusion efforts.
Proficiency in HRIS systems and reporting.
Experience conducting HR related trainings.
Detail oriented with excellent organization skills and the ability to plan for and manage multiple priorities.
Must be able to work independently and manage responsibilities with limited supervision.
Understanding of and ability to work with people of diverse national, ethnic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Commitment to working to end Domestic Violence.
Interfaces with all staff throughout the organization on HR related issues within the span of their responsibilities.
Minimum Salary: $58,500
Benefits:
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
Employer-paid life insurance
Employer retirement contribution
Paid time off
Flex spending account
Student loan assistance
Tuition reimbursement program
Gym reimbursement program
All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, creed (religion), color, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, military status, age, disability, predisposing genetic characteristic, marital status or domestic violence victim status, and shall also follow the requirements of the Human Rights Law with regard to non-discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.
D.E.I Commitment: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are core values at Sanctuary for Families that represent our dedication to fostering a safe, respectful, responsive, and fair work environment. We recognize the value diversity holds in embracing all employees, clients, and volunteers regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or professional level.

The Mill is a global creative partner for agencies, production companies and brands, working across all media channels and platforms.
We are trusted specialists in visual effects, creative technologies and content production Our projects include the creation of digital products and virtual experiences, as well as world class visual effects and video production.

Job Description
The VFX Production team as a whole is responsible for managing the artists, schedules and client expectations of all of our advertising VFX work. If you have a passion for production and VFX then we want to hear from you!
VFX Production Coordinators are the glue for all of our creative teams. They are the first link between the creative brief and its execution in accordance with the budgeted cost, resources and timeline, helping to shepherd projects through the entire creative life cycle of a project and ensuring that things run smoothly on a global and day-to-day basis. Coordinators support the Producers and VFX Supervisors and complete tasks in close collaboration with them and our Artists.
We're looking for candidates that are resilient, proactive and know how to work and think as part of a team.
What you’ll do
Assisting VFX Producers, Supervisors, Leads & Artists to ensure the smooth running of our VFX Projects, locally in NY and also with global team members.
Managing schedules and tracking projects to ensure all internal and external targets are met.
Anticipating deadline challenges and communicating this to other members of the team to problem solve and plan accordingly.
Managing and running reviews, dailies and calls and relaying back minutes and notes to all involved.

Qualifications
What you’ll need:
Essentials
Ability to work well in a deadline-driven creative environment.
Adept in prioritizing tasks with excellent organization skills.
Clear, confident communicator.
Scheduling experience a plus.
Technical Skills
Proficiency with MS Office, especially Excel.
Experience with shot production tools like Shotgun and f-track also a big plus.
Experience
2+ years of relevant VFX post-production experience and a good understanding of VFX pipelines and workflows.

You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every
day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Customer Experience Communications Team – Editor

The Global Services Group – Communications Team oversees the writing, editing, development, and governance of clear, timely, authentic, and meaningful servicing communications that show our customers that American Express recognizes their needs and provides relevant solutions. To achieve this mission, the team works with business partners to craft high-quality communications which embody our Customer First principles, while also ensuring they are delivered by expected deadlines. We aim to deliver these communications in the customer’s channel of choice and ensure they are part of thoughtful and relevant customer journeys. Typical servicing communications reviewed by the team include emails, letters, web content, SMS, statement, and FAQs - with a focus on digital communications and paper-off efforts.

We are looking to fill this position with a well-rounded Analyst who possesses exceptional editing and written communication skills, strong attention to detail, and project and process management skills to also help manage the team’s workflow.

As an integral part of the Customer Experience Communications Team, the optimal candidates will be equally passionate about communications and the customer experience in order to successfully:
Review, edit, and approve servicing communications in the U.S. and International markets.
Influence the voice and tone of servicing communications.
Support the End-to-End Communication Governance, principles and standards that ensure our communications are customer first and digitally savvy.
Help manage the team’s day to day workflow and pipeline of communication requests, including prioritization.
Assist business partners with the development of customer-focused communication plans.
Collaborate with business and compliance partners to develop optimal communications capabilities and content.
Partner with Technologies on the building and revising of communication templates on the production platforms.
Identify areas of opportunity to reduce manual efforts and implement best practices for CEC team and end users.

Requirements:
Bachelor degree or higher, preferred
Prior editing experience required. This could be in any industry (eg publishing), but financial services preferred.
Strong writer and editor with exceptional written communication skills, and the ability to vary style by channel and audience.
Customer focus, balanced with a rational business sense.
Superior relationship management skills with the ability to influence change, yet maintain a positive rapport.
Demonstrated thought leader, and creative problem solver.
Affinity for collaboration with teammates and partners.
Strong analytical, organizational and critical thinking skills.
Ability to manage a range of projects and responsibilities simultaneously with strict deadlines.
Ability to work autonomously
Prior financial services background helpful, but not required.

Chairperson - Humanities and Media Studies Department (71100)

Location: Brooklyn, NY

Description:
The School of Liberal Arts and Sciences at Pratt Institute invites applications for the position of Chair of the Department of Humanities and Media Studies. The ideal candidate will be a visionary leader as well as an established scholar and/or creative practitioner; they will have considerable administrative experience and will have earned the rank of associate or full professor with tenure. Reporting to the Dean of Liberal Arts and Sciences, the Chair advises a diverse group of faculty in the development of the curriculum and oversees day-to-day operations of a vibrant, collegial, and multidisciplinary department of 20 full-time and more than 50 part-time faculty.


The Department of Humanities and Media Studies (HMS) is an innovative and multidisciplinary department with graduate programs in Media Studies (M.A.) and Performance and Performance Studies (M.F.A.). At the undergraduate level, the department offers a core curriculum of required courses in the humanities to the entire Institute and minors in Literature and Writing, Cinema Studies, Media Studies, and Performance and Performance Studies. The department also offers elective courses and courses for Institute-wide minors in The Book, Black Studies, and Social Justice and Social Practice. The department is known for an extensive range of innovative studio writing courses and writing workshops, working across the disciplines of an art and design school, and is further distinguished by a program in Architecture Writing that integrates and cross-links courses in the humanities and architecture.


The Department Chair will mentor and oversee a faculty drawn to Pratt by the opportunity to work in the multidisciplinary environment of a top-rated and internationally recognized school of art, design, architecture, and information, and to teach students who are highly creative and academically prepared. The chair will embrace the department's intellectual and creative mission of engagement in socially informed humanities as well as its multidisciplinary approach to scholarship and creative practice, both in themselves and in their co-evolution with each other and with their art and design school environment.


Located on Pratt's historic 25-acre campus in the culturally diverse neighborhood of Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, Pratt draws students from diverse cultural and geographic backgrounds. We are committed to advancing diversity and inclusion in our curriculum as well as in the ranks of our faculty, students, and staff and seek applicants who can contribute to the furtherance of these goals.

Job Responsibilities:

Encourage and advance a vision for the Department


Supervise Assistant Chair and Assistant to the Chair

Appoint and direct program coordinators supporting academic degree programs

Oversee teaching assignments and course scheduling

Oversee faculty recruitment, evaluation, and development

Convene departmental faculty meetings

Oversee curriculum development and revision

Administer the department's budget

Advance collaboration between HMS and other SLAS departments

Participate in divisional and Institute committees as assigned by Dean

Carry out special projects and assume other related duties as required


Qualifications:
Education:

A Ph.D. or M.F.A in a relevant discipline is required.


Experience:

Applicants must have a minimum of 7+ years college-level teaching experience in a relevant discipline and must have earned tenure and be at the rank of Associate or Full Professor. The candidate must have a record of scholarly and/or creative accomplishments and at least two years of administrative experience, preferably at or commensurate with the chair level.


Skills:

Strong administrative, communication, and interpersonal skills, and the capability to work in a dynamic environment in which collaboration across academic departments and Schools, as well as across Institute offices, is required.


The ability to balance the day-to-day administrative duties of the position with the intellectual and creative challenge of leading faculty, coordinating the work of curriculum development, and furthering the strategic vision of the department.


Experience working with a unionized faculty is a plus.

Salary is commensurate with education and experience.

Application Instructions:
To apply, visit https://apply.interfolio.com/99906

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, marital or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, sex, gender identity or expression, age, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.Pratt Institute recognizes and values the benefits of a diverse workforce.

Overview
Madison Square Garden Sports Corp. (MSG Sports) is a leading professional sports company, with a collection of assets that includes: the New York Knicks (NBA) and the New York Rangers (NHL); two development league teams – the Westchester Knicks (NBAGL) and the Hartford Wolf Pack (AHL); and esports teams through Counter Logic Gaming, a leading North American esports organization, and Knicks Gaming, an NBA 2K League franchise. MSG Sports also owns two professional sports team performance centers – the MSG Training Center in Greenburgh, NY and the CLG Performance Center in Los Angeles, CA. More information is available at www.msgsports.com.

Role Summary
The Financial Analyst supports financial reporting & planning activities for the MSG Sports ticketing departments. The Analyst assists in the preparation of post-game event P&Ls, commission calculations, analysis of revenue and expenses and detailed calculations on intercompany transactions. The Financial Analyst assists in the preparation of a detailed budgets for ticket revenue and expenses. The Analyst compiles ticket related league reporting requests for the NBA, NHL, AHL and G-League.

Specific Functions/Activities Summary
Assists in the compilation of details for the annual budget in timely, thorough manner. These areas include Ticket Revenue, Ticketing Fees, variable game expenses and G&A departmental expenses.
Assist in the preparation of post-game event P&Ls with comparison to budget.
Assist in the preparation of detailed commission calculations and associated analysis.
Prepare detailed analysis of monthly results and variance reporting to the business groups and attend meetings to review and discuss the results and inform real time projections. Requires a deep and detailed understanding of the business through continual communication with department staff
Assist Sports business staff to troubleshoot / navigate through finance or accounting questions, concerns, or system questions
Assist in the completion of detailed forecasts and monthly outlooks
Responsible to work closely with Teams Accounting to ensure accurate reporting of Revenues, Expenses and Balance Sheets Accounts for the teams
Assist in completion of all NBA, NHL, G-League and AHL ticket reporting and surveys.
Assist with special projects and financial analysis and modeling

Qualifications
1+ years’ experience and a Bachelor’s degree required (in Finance / Accounting preferred), CPA a plus but not required
Must have strong advance Excel skills while experience in Oracle and Hyperion, applications is a plus.
Advance analytical, accounting and financial skills are required.
Experience in budgets, forecasts and monthly analysis reporting and monthly closes.
Must be able to work with various operating groups and assist the Accounting Department at month-end.
Communication Skills – must present themselves in a professional manner and communicate regularly with executives in multiple divisions as well as outside the company
Demonstrated flexibility – must be able to juggle various projects and be willing to change projects as needed
High Energy and Commitment – must display a positive, confident assertive personality and be able to work on projects until completion.
The Company requires that all individuals, subject to certain limited exceptions, be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. The Company will consider requests for reasonable accommodations regarding this requirement.

Education
Bachelor’s degree required
